quest.name: Dressed to Deceive
journal: Isembard wants to help you identify and apprehend the false priest.

Thancred suggests that the two of you pose as impoverished souls in order to ensnare the false priest. By way of laying the foundation for this plan, you must first make it known that vagrants have newly arrived at Camp Drybone. Don a weathered shepherd's tunic and a pair of weathered shepherd's slops, and beg the residents of the camp for work.
You have made a sufficient nuisance of yourself to draw the attention of the false priest. Report back to Thancred.

It would seem that the poor have established a commune by a pond north of Sandgate, to the east of Camp Drybone. Owing to its isolation, Thancred believes it an ideal place for kidnappers to do their work. Don your disguise once more, and rendezvous with Thancred at said pond.

The false priest turns out to be none other than Ungust, the obnoxious merchant whom you first found preying upon a refugee woman in Ul'dah. The man reveals that he has been abducting people at the behest of the Amalj'aa. Take this knowledge back to Minfilia, who awaits at the Waking Sands in Vesper Bay.
Praising your investigative work, Minfilia tells you that an encounter with the Amalj'aa is inevitable. Be prepared to answer the call to arms when the time comes.
objectives: Speak with the locals while garbed in a weathered shepherd's tunic and a pair of weathered shepherd's slops.
Speak with Thancred while garbed in a weathered shepherd's tunic and a pair of weathered shepherd's slops.
Speak with Minfilia at the Waking Sands.

dialogue.name: ISEMBARD
dialogue.text: I'm afraid I have not seen any unusual activity. Nor have any at this camp given me cause to doubt them. But unless we can identify the culprit, and soon, more innocents will fall victim...

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Do not despair just yet, my friend. An idea occurs to me.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Our suspect has been posing as a priest, using leaflets bearing false promises to lure the poor. Let Forename and me serve like with like by posing as impoverished souls in need of succor.

dialogue.name: ISEMBARD
dialogue.text: Ah, I dare to hope that this will yield us the answers we seek. It will be a dangerous undertaking, but you two are more than capable of looking after yourselves.

dialogue.name: ISEMBARD
dialogue.text: I'm next to useless in a battle, but I can supply the garments for the disguise. These old tunics and slops should serve your needs, so long as you don't mind the smell and the stains.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: These will serve very well. You have my thanks.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Listen, Forename. So as to lay the foundation for our little ploy, we must make it widely known that more vagrants have arrived at camp and are desperate for coin.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: To this end, I want you to don the old garments Isembard has lent us, and beg for work around the camp. Before long, the false priest should catch wind and approach us.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I want you to don the old garments Isembard has lent us, and beg for work around the camp. Before long, the false priest should catch wind and approach us.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: In case you misplace the tunic and the slops, you'll need to ask Isembard for another set.

dialogue.name: KNERL
dialogue.text: Hm? And you are...?

dialogue.name: KNERL
dialogue.text: Hmph, another refugee, by the looks of you. The Immortal Flames have neither work nor coin for your like. Begone, and see to it you don't make a nuisance of yourself.

dialogue.name: KNERL
dialogue.text: Ah, an adventurer. You are welcome at Camp Drybone, friend. I hope we can rely on your aid to preserve the peace in the area.

dialogue.name: SWAENHYLT
dialogue.text: I preach the teachings of Azeyma, the Warden. Hast thou come to partake of the honey of Her wisdom?

dialogue.name: SWAENHYLT
dialogue.text: Azeyma is keeper of the sun and goddess of inquiry. All is laid bare beneath the light of Her divine countenance. Open thy heart to this light, needy child, and thou shalt want for naught till the end of days!

dialogue.name: SWAENHYLT
dialogue.text: Azeyma is keeper of the sun and goddess of inquiry. All is laid bare beneath the light of Her divine countenance. Open thy heart to this light, adventurer, and thou shalt know true fulfillment!

dialogue.name: AURILDIS
dialogue.text: What is it?

dialogue.name: AURILDIS
dialogue.text: Gods, not again... Look, being poor doesn't give you the right to pester whomsoever you like. Why don't you keep with your own kind out by that muddy pond of yours at Drybone?

dialogue.name: AURILDIS
dialogue.text: If you don't mind, I'm rather busy at the moment. Go and find someone else to pester.

dialogue.name: ERMEGARDE
dialogue.text: Greetings, good madamsir. Is there aught I might assist you with?

dialogue.name: ERMEGARDE
dialogue.text: ...Oh. I...don't believe there is. I'm afraid our wares are very expensive. Mayhap you should rejoin your fellows out at the pond north of Sandgate.

dialogue.name: ERMEGARDE
dialogue.text: We stock only the finest wares. If you wish to make a purchase, our attendant at the counter will be glad to serve you.

dialogue.name: ADELSTAN
dialogue.text: <sigh> And I was about to get to the good part...

dialogue.name: ADELSTAN
dialogue.text: Looking for work, you say? Sorry, but we don't have any openings. Now, get out of here so I can finish my story.

dialogue.name: ADELSTAN
dialogue.text: You've got a hunger, adventurer? Then you've come to the right place. You won't find better hot meals for malms around.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: You have quite a knack for being a nuisance, Forename. The camp is abuzz with talk of newly arrived vagrants.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: And though we were unable to attract our wayward transgressor, we were able to learn that the poor have a commune by the pond north of Sandgate, to the east of here. The eyes of the authorities do not reach that place─rather ideal for spiriting away hapless souls.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Let us go there and wait for the kindly priest to come and offer us aid and comfort. Needless to say you'll need to remain in disguise.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: A fine eveningmorningday for catching false priests, wouldn't you say?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Hm? Why aren't you wearing the lovely soiled garments Isembard gave you? Dressed as you are, our quarry will sense that something is amiss before he's within nabbing distance.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: In case you've accidentally disposed of the tunic and slops, you'll need to ask Isembard for another set.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: You look absolutely smashing, Forename─positively dressed for deception. All that's left, then, is to wait for our quarry to appear.

dialogue.name: UNGUST
dialogue.text: (-???-)Oh, you poor, unfortunate souls. This is no way for men to live. No way at all.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Who are you? What do you want?

dialogue.name: UNGUST
dialogue.text: (-???-)Be at ease, child, for I mean you no harm. I am a priest of the Order of Nald'thal, and I come to offer you succor.

dialogue.name: UNGUST
dialogue.text: (-???-)This leaflet bears the teachings of Nald. Trust to them, and they will surely set you free from the shackles of penury!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Hmmm... A tempting offer, but I'm afraid I must decline...

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: ...On account of that atrocious performance. You would have made a gods–awful mummer, Ungust.

dialogue.name: UNGUST
dialogue.text: Wh-What!? How did you know─!? Y-You bastards tricked me!

dialogue.name: UNGUST
dialogue.text: P-Please don't hurt me! I was only doing it to protect my people!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Is that so? Do continue.

dialogue.name: UNGUST
dialogue.text:
V-Very well...
I'm a man of the Golden Bazaar. Raised there, if not born.

dialogue.name: UNGUST
dialogue.text: Some moons ago, the Amalj'aa raids began. They would appear sudden as a sandstorm, and plunder and pillage at will. Our defenders couldn't stand against them, few as they were. Everyone lived in fear.

dialogue.name: UNGUST
dialogue.text: I wanted to save my people, but being a merchant was all I knew. And so I did the only thing a merchant could─I approached the Amalj'aa in hopes of brokering a deal.

dialogue.name: UNGUST
dialogue.text: In return for sparing the Golden Bazaar, they made demands─outrageous ones.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Demands? Of what kind, pray tell?

dialogue.name: UNGUST
dialogue.text: First of all, they wanted the schedule for crystal shipments from the Nanawa Mines. For this, I bribed one of the workers to leak me the information.

dialogue.name: UNGUST
dialogue.text: Next, they wanted me to bring them people. So, I posed as a priest to lure in the vulnerable and give them over to the Amalj'aa. I...I didn't have a choice...

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Protecting one's home is a noble thing...but at the cost of innocents? You could have sought the aid of the Immortal Flames, yet you did not. I suspect you are not telling me the full story. What made you sell out your own people? Speak!

dialogue.name: UNGUST
dialogue.text: The...<mumble>...was good...

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: What did you say?

dialogue.name: UNGUST
dialogue.text: The coin was good, I said! I could sell mole meat for a score of lifetimes and not see even a fraction of what the Amalj'aa pay me!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: You sacrificed innocents so that you could line your own pockets? Words fail to express the contempt I feel for you.

dialogue.name: UNGUST
dialogue.text: Spare me your contempt! If you want to blame someone for the mess the world's in, then blame yourselves or the gods!

dialogue.name: UNGUST
dialogue.text: Uwaaah! Not you again!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Were you the one leaking the Immortal Flames' patrol routes to the enemy as well? Spit it out!

dialogue.name: UNGUST
dialogue.text: Nooo! I know nothing about that! I swear it!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: At this stage, I'm rather disinclined to believe aught that leaves your mouth. But no matter. There'll be time enough to learn the truth.

dialogue.name: UNGUST
dialogue.text: <sob>

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Forename. Be a deargood man and take word of these developments to Minfilia, would you?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I shall prise everything I can out of this filth.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: The abductees are still somewhere out there. Our foremost priority is to rescue them.

dialogue.name: MINFILLIA
dialogue.text: Welcome back, Forename. I am pleased that you and Thancred have been getting along.

dialogue.name: MINFILLIA
dialogue.text: I see... You have done well to uncover the truth. My thanks for the report.

dialogue.name: MINFILLIA
dialogue.text: As Thancred said, we must ascertain where the abducted were taken...and none but the Amalj'aa know the answer.

dialogue.name: MINFILLIA
dialogue.text: Suffice it to say they will not willingly part with this information. I fear blood will be spilled before all is said and done.

dialogue.name: ISEMBARD
dialogue.text: Misplaced your disguise, you say? I will give you loan of another set, but do take better care of it.
